channel.title: 3mpwr App - Curated Disability News
channel.description: Daily curated news on disability rights, accessibility, and benefits across Canada

item.title: What's going on with the Canada Post strikes?
item.description: More than a month into rotating Canada Post strikes, workers and the businesses that use the national postal service are grappling with uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: ‘Ottawa is creating an emergency': Quebec minister on temporary immigration cuts
item.description: Immigration Minister Jean-François Roberge said Ottawa’s new restrictions on temporary foreign workers have left businesses facing severe labour shortages.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Shots ring out at Universal Ostrich farm in Edgewood, B.C.
item.description: It happened the same day the Supreme Court of Canada declined to hear an appeal to save the flock at Universal Ostrich from a cull ordered by the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA).
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: How the son of Russian spies paved the legal path for B.C. ostrich cull
item.description: In his battle for Canadian citizenship, Alexander Vavilov got an opportunity denied to the owners of B.C.'s Universal Ostrich Farms — a chance to argue his case before Canada's top court. In the process, the son of Russian spies set a legal standard for decision-making "reasonableness" that would doom the B.C. birds six years later.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Ontario still short of long-term care bed goal, data in fiscal update show
item.description: Ontario has built 6,700 new long-term care beds with 18,000 more underway, still short of its 58,000-bed goal by 2028; but officials say new funding will help meet the target.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: 18 poultry farms in B.C. dealing with avian flu outbreaks
item.description: Shawn Hall, director of the B.C. Poultry Industry Emergency Operations Centre, told Global News that it is a concerning time for poultry farmers in the province.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Federal budget cuts to public sector will weaken services, unions warn
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Conservative MP Matt Jeneroux resigns from House of Commons ahead of budget vote
item.description: Conservative MP Matt Jeneroux said Thursday he is resigning from the House of Commons, becoming the second Conservative to leave the caucus this week.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Teachers' union taking Alberta government to court over notwithstanding clause
item.description: The Alberta Teachers’ Association has filed a constitutional challenge of a provincial government law that forced educators across the province back to work and imposed a new contract.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Saskatchewan sexual assault centres fighting to get back into schools
item.description: Sexual assault prevention education has been banned in schools and organizations are trying to get the program back, as it showed success in helping kids understand sexual abuse.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: This Ontario town is on a mission to end homelessness by 2027. Here’s how it's going
item.description: When Sara Pepper was living on the streets of St. Thomas, Ont., a few years back, she says there wasn’t much in the way of support. These days, she says, things are looking brighter — but there's still plenty of work to do.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: On Our Radar: Buddie turns its completely understandable stress into something beautiful
item.description: Guitar bands are back in Vancouver, and it’s beautiful.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: By the numbers: Here's what needs to happen in a budget vote to avoid an election
item.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s government was elected just a few seats shy of a majority, meaning the Liberals will need the cooperation of one of the opposition parties to pass its budget.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Downtown Calgary police operation nets 25 arrests, refers 115 to social agencies
item.description: On Wednesday, the Calgary Police Service conducted Operation Order, which saw officers redeployed from other parts of the city to patrol key areas in the downtown core.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: REAL CEO steps down less than 5 months after appointment
item.description: The organization announced that president and CEO Rick Bennett has departed for personal and family reasons, after a tenure that saw him unveil two major announcements for Regina.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Buying a new car? Hidden cameras show some Ontario dealerships adding extra charges and features
item.description: Marketplace visited 15 car dealerships in the Greater Toronto Area with hidden cameras rolling, posing as customers to see if dealerships honour the price in their ads. We found out some car dealerships add extra charges or features.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Intercepted communications link Indian government to B.C. Sikh leader's assassination
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: How the Abundance Movement Is Dividing the Left
item.description: Calls for fewer rules and faster building have found a progressive audience, including in the BC government.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Are People Losing Trust in BC’s FOI System?
item.description: The province’s information commissioner says plunging numbers of requests should prompt questions.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator

item.title: Communities shut water intake from B.C. lake after fuel spill reaches 80,000 litres
item.description: A local official says small communities on Kamloops Lake in British Columbia have been shutting down their intakes from the waterway after it was revealed that more than 80,000 litres of aviation fuel spilled on its shores in a train derailment last weekend.
item.dc:creator: 3mpwr App Curator
